feed.title: Review: Runespell: Overture
feed.subtitle: "Runespell: Overture" is a role-playing poker game that has you taking on the role of a Changeling as you battle monsters through exotic locations in hopes of saving the world.

link.title: "Runespell: Overture" is a role-playing poker game that has you taking on the role of a Changeling as you battle monsters through exotic locations in hopes of saving the world.

content.div:
Platform: PC

If I said "role-playing poker," you would probably imagine a game where you create an avatar complete with a baseball cap and sunglasses as you prepare to enter a casino tournament in hopes of striking it rich. In actuality, "Runespell: Overture" is a role-playing poker game that has you taking on the role of a Changeling as you battle monsters through exotic locations in hopes of saving the world.

This brilliant combination of genres will have you combining cards to create strong poker hands that in turn become powerful attacks. The gameplay mechanic is simple: Maneuver cards into various stacks. If the stack contains a pair, it creates a small attack. If it has a straight, it creates a larger attack. If you're not very good at cards, you can rest easy thanks to the numerous allies waiting in the wings to bolster your offense.

"Runespell: Overture" may not be the deepest game with the most beautiful graphics, but its unique style and gameplay are enough to create a fun and addictive experience for poker and RPG fans alike.
